questions.text: Which character sang 'I'll Take You Home Again, Kathleen' over and over?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Reilly.

	He was under the PSI 2000 virus' influence. He sang this over the shipwide intercom after he commandiered Engineering.

questions.text: TOS aired on what network?
questions.explanation: NBC & nbc.

questions.text: What TOS character was the only one to carry over from the original pilot, 'The Cage'?
questions.explanation:
Spock.

	Ironically, he was specified by the network as one character to eliminate before the next pilot.

questions.text: Which TOS character did NOT appear on any TNG episodes?
questions.explanation:
Kirk.

	Kirk did appear in the cross-over movie 'Star Trek: Generations' Spock appeared in the TNG two-parter 'Unification' McCoy appeared in the TNG pilot 'Encounter at Farpoint' Scotty appeared in the TNG episode 'Relics'

questions.text: What actress gave up the part of Capt. Janeway (VOY) after only one day of filming?
questions.explanation:
Genevieve Bujold.

	It was said that she couldn't handle the fast pace of a TV production.

questions.text: Which Star Trek actor played a doomed airline pilot in Die Hard 2?
questions.explanation:
Colm Meaney.

	The villians in the movie had recalibrated the ILS beams to indicate that the ground was further away than it was.

questions.text: Who was the first actor after John de Lancie to portray a Q entity?
questions.explanation:
Corbin Bernsen.

	TNG Episode 'Deja Q'

questions.text: In Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home, the part of 'Punk on Bus' was played by this crewman of the movie itself:
questions.explanation:
Kirk Thatcher, associate producer.

	He also wrote and sang the song that was blaring out of his boom box in the scene.

questions.text: How did James T. Kirk ultimately die?
options: Killed by Spock during Vulcan Marriage Ritual
questions.explanation:
Fell with a collapsing bridge.

	While helping Picard defeat Soran.

questions.text: What was Worf's human surname?
questions.explanation: Rozhenko.

questions.text: VOY: How do the actors Robert Beltran, Robert Picardo, and Robert Duncan McNeill avoid confusion on set because of their names being the same?
options: Nicknames based on their hair: Baldy for Picardo, Blondie for McNeill
Go by their character names: Chakotay, Doctor, Paris
Go by their initials: RB, RP, RM
questions.explanation: Different nicknames: Robert, Bob, Robbie.

questions.text: TAS: Who provided most of the extra male voices?
questions.explanation: James Doohan.

questions.text: What actor played three different aliens who all ultimately died in various Star Trek productions?
questions.explanation:
Mark Lenard.

	1. The Romulan Commander, TOS episode 'Balance of Terror', self-destructed his ship 2. A Klingon Captain, 'Star Trek: The Motion Picture', killed by V'Ger 3. Sarek, TNG episode 'Unification', ravages of congenital disease (He played Sarek in several previous productions, but this it where he died.)

questions.text: The Bajoran Wormhole leads from the Bajoran system to which quadrant of the Milky Way galaxy:
questions.explanation: Gamma.

questions.text: To which quadrant of the Milky Way galaxy was Voyager transported to?
questions.explanation: Delta.

questions.text: To which Star Trek actress was Gene Roddenberry married to?
questions.explanation: Majel Barrett.

questions.text: What metal is the base for Vulcan hemoglobin?
questions.explanation: Copper.

questions.text: Which of these characters is NOT an alien-human cross-breed?
questions.explanation:
Worf.

	However, he was raise by humans after his Klingon parents died.

questions.text: What character's name is also the name of a sub-atomic particle?
questions.explanation: Quark.

questions.text: Which Star Trek actress came in 4th in the Miss America Pageant?
questions.explanation:
Jeri Lynn Ryan.

	In the 1990 pageant. Lee Meriwether actually won the 1955 pageant.
